plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A fragrant white lily native to the Balkans and Middle East, often cultivated in gardens. It produces large, trumpet-shaped flowers with a sweet scent.
plants.funFact: The Madonna Lily has been cultivated since ancient times and is associated with purity in Christian symbolism.

plants.name: Rhododendron ferrugineum
plants.description: A low-growing, evergreen shrub with bright pink to red bell-shaped flowers. It is common in alpine and subalpine regions.
plants.location: Alps and other European mountain ranges
plants.funFact: The Alpenrose thrives in acidic soils and rocky slopes, contributing to the unique alpine flora.

plants.name: Nelumbo nucifera
plants.description: An aquatic plant with large, circular leaves and striking pink or white flowers that float on water surfaces.
plants.location: Asia, including India, China, and Southeast Asia
plants.funFact: The Sacred Lotus flower closes at night and reopens with the morning sun, symbolizing spiritual enlightenment in many cultures.
